children.subject: Rao and Walrand are coteaching, not Wagner.

history.content:
As your colleague below (and the schedule of classes) makes clear it is Professor Walrand who is co-teaching CS70 with Professor Rao.

See http://osoc.berkeley.edu/OSOC/osoc?p_term=SP&x=0&p_classif=--+Choose+a+Course+Classification+--&p_deptname=--+Choose+a+Department+Name+--&p_presuf=--+Choose+a+Course+Prefix%2fSuffix+--&y=0&p_course=70&p_dept=cs and/or http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-s2.html .  

Teaching assignments for F16/SP17 are not yet made.  When they are, you can see them here: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-draft.html 

It is often a good idea to use phase 1 for courses that are required to make progress towards major declaration and graduation.  If you were only going to be able to phase 1 one of the two, CS70 makes the most sense as long as you are wiling to be flexible about lab/dis times for 61B.

61B and 70 are both a significant amount of work. 61C and 70 is often more manageable.  That being said, the instructional teams teaching 61B and 70 might make this more manageable than would otherwise be the case in some semesters.

In response to the last section of the instructors' answer below: I had a slightly different understanding of the workload of 61B vs 61C (I wasn't aware that 61C was thought of as more manageable than 61B). I suspect that most students would take 70 in the spring are taking concurrently with 61B, and most who take in the fall are taking with 61C. This was brought up at a staff meeting for 70 last fall, and no one seemed to disagree; the context is a discussion of potential factors causing differing student performances in the spring vs fall, where one theory was that 61C was more time-consuming to take with 70 than 61B.

Is CS70 being taught by Wagner and Rao next semester? As in, are they both coteaching a class? Do you happen to know who is teaching it in fall 2016? 

Would you recommend phase 1ing cs61b and cs70 for L&S intended cs? Is it a good idea to take both of those classes together if I'm doing ok in cs61a (A-/A level work)?Or is the risk not necessary and should I just take the classes separately so the 3.3 gpa will be easier to meet? 

Thanks for feedback.
history.subject: CS70
